Articles.Content:
So, what are your favorite christian songs. I had a similar thread in MP.net not long ago, but the website has permanently shut down.

Yeah, I'm religious. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Here's mine

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jJmyg22Z9-o?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pWem1xprUMc?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

I have some favorites from the 50's and 80's, but I think I'll leave them out of here. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

And for all of you non religious heathens (I kid ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) ) Here's a music video.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Y45rzmDaABI?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-18T04:57:13Z" title="05/18/2015 04:57  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 18, 2015</time> by andrew123**

> 
> Get ready for the moderator artillery:

This is no religious discussion. It is merely a thread for christian type music.

So no. It does not violate the rules, since this thread is not meant for religious discussion.

> 
> This is no religious discussion. It is merely a thread for christian type music.
> So no. It does not violate the rules, since this thread is not meant for religious discussion.

Yeah but I know this community all too well and i know that this will get derailed and turn into qn argument.

Depends. Do you mean church type songs, or listen on the radio type songs?

IMHO, the two should not really cross, church type songs need to be signable by groups of people who aren't necessarily good at signing. Though some of my pentecostal friends may disagree...

With church type songs, my long time favorites would have to include, *Shine, Jesus Shine*, *My redeemer lives*, I also quite like some of the imagery in *Indescribable* 

In radio type songs, I quite like stuff by Relient K, switchfoot, and the older stuff by Newsboys. There's some good newer stuff, but I haven't been paying enough attention to recall any names.

Sister Act Soundtrack, but only because the movie was funny.

Ask youtube for: Billy Connolly christian rock

Probably this.

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/2bosouX_d8Y?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

To hear this in a large cathedral would be a superb experience.

Try this.

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/7bJ1aP54gas?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Also check out other not christian songs from her like "Miserere Venere" and "Spente Le Stelle".[h=1][/h]

Easy one:

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/l482T0yNkeo?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pWRJAHaOrYg?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/khairmZadHg?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-18T16:38:58Z" title="05/18/2015 04:38  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 18, 2015</time> by LordFerret**

andrew123's right, as long as this thread doesn't devolve into a discussion *about* religion or people who are religious then I think it is pretty harmless.

That said, we'll be watching the thread for signs of that derailment, so please refrain from discussing those topics.

Wow, I'm surprised at how many fellow christians there are here. I wasn't expecting it at all. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

My favorite songs...I have way way too many. ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

I like this Christian rock:

![religion-christian-rock-cross-10643935.jpg](http://thumbs.dreamstime.com/x/religion-christian-rock-cross-10643935.jpg)

> 
> I like this Christian rock:
> [http://thumbs.dreamstime.com/x/religion-christian-rock-cross-10643935.jpg](http://thumbs.dreamstime.com/x/religion-christian-rock-cross-10643935.jpg)

Can songs and rocks be christian? Are they baptised? Do they go to heaven?

Easily this one:

[http://youtu.be/jHPOzQzk9Qo](https://youtu.be/jHPOzQzk9Qo)

A perfect christian message, combined with catchy whistling and the right amount of humour ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Can songs and rocks be christian? Are they baptised? Do they go to heaven?

I'm not actually a christian, I just like puns
I have found that nearly every christian song follows the same exact pattern, very similar to country music. (That's why I listen to neither.)

Spiritualist here. Too eclectic to ever fit into a world religion, believe in some things without solid evidence (though I've seen some really weird unexplainable &@^#! in my life), but also am completely opposed to the notion that scientific progress should ever be impeded by such things.

Anyway, most of what I could list off here, I doubt anyone *doesn't* know. I was never big into Christian rock even when I was walking that path. Of the mainstream songs that always got me...

Religious or not, if you haven't heard these, you've probably been living under a rock. And if you have heard these, you probably want to shoot me now. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/He3qmXo0oww?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/4jrjdbDAPQk?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/BRPGRdbGHSs?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

A bit more off the beaten path... well-known artists' songs that aren't very well-known.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/8-Y6EKQrYSY?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/P0D5qZvhP_k?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Your call if you want to classify TSO as Christian music. It's one of their original compositions, and it's about Jesus. \*shrug\* This song moves me like practically nothing else I've ever heard.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-18T18:50:45Z" title="05/18/2015 06:50  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 18, 2015</time> by vger**
While I'm not religious, Russian Orthodox chants get to me real good. I have no idea what they sing but the harmonies and display of what the human voice can do makes for some stunning music.

I've been a Christian for a long time, and I've been listening to Christian music for a long time. Randy Stonehill, Steve Taylor, The Choir, The 77s, Lost Dogs, plenty of others, but those are the first ones that come to mind. Sorry, not big into YouTube, but I'm sure if you Google them some examples will come up.

I range from 

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tId6ePj7Zpo?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

to

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/qkSPe7mvELo?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Also I didn't know you were religious too.
I do not listen to music; the spacing between the "notes" (I am tone deaf) is a distraction from the words.

One very nice collection

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JUohUrWlJeE?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

I'm flat out a non-believer.

However, I will often pull up some version of this and use it as background music while I'm working:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Vz_6zSjNxMI?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
Skillet and The Sidewalk Prophets are the bands I listen to the most. 'Live Like That' is my current top song. (I
